title: ISSS608-VAA
text: Welcome to ISSS608 Visual Analytics and Applications! In this website, you will find my coursework prepared for this course.

title: About
text:
About this site

1 + 1

[1] 2

title: Hands-on EX 1
text:
The code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)





exam_data <- read.csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

title: Hands-on EX 1
text:
The code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)

title: Hands-on EX 1
text: exam_data <- read.csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

title: Hands-on EX 1
text:
remove y axis

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot(binwidth=2.5,         
               dotsize = 0.5) +      
  scale_y_continuous(NULL,           
                     breaks = NULL)

title: Hands-on EX 1
text:
changing object by changing geom()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20,            
                 color="black",      
                 fill="light blue")

title: Hands-on EX 1
text:
changing object by changing aes()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           fill = GENDER)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 color="grey30")

title: Hands-on EX 1
text:
add another line

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS, 
           colour = GENDER)) +
  geom_density()

title: Hands-on EX 1
text:
plotting a notched plot

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot(notch=TRUE)

title: Hands-on EX 1
text:
plotting a violin plot

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x= GENDER)) +
  geom_violin()

title: Hands-on EX 1
section: add mean value for box plot using stat_summary()
text:
add mean value for box plot using stat_summary()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  stat_summary(geom = "point",       
               fun = "mean",         
               colour ="red",        
               size=4)

title: Hands-on EX 1
section: add mean value for box plot using geom()
text:
add mean value for box plot using geom()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(stat="summary",        
             fun="mean",           
             colour="red",          
             size=4)

title: Hands-on EX 1
text:
changing the smothing method

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              linewidth=0.5)

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Hands-on EX 1
section: plotting a trellis plot using facet_grid()
text:
plotting a trellis plot using facet_grid()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20) +
    facet_grid(~ CLASS)

title: Hands-on EX 1
section: changing range from 0-100 to know the exact relationship
text:
changing range from 0-100 to know the exact relationship

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              size=0.5) +  
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100))

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Hands-on EX 1
text:
theme_gray

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_gray()

title: Hands-on EX 1
text:
theme_classic

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_classic()

title: Hands-on EX 1
text:
theme_minimal()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_minimal()

title: Hands-on_Ex02
text:
The code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if needed packages are installed in the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(ggrepel, patchwork, 
               ggthemes, hrbrthemes,
               tidyverse) 





exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

Rows: 322 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): ID, CLASS, GENDER, RACE
dbl (3): ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

title: Hands-on_Ex02
text:
The code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if needed packages are installed in the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(ggrepel, patchwork, 
               ggthemes, hrbrthemes,
               tidyverse)

title: Hands-on_Ex02
text:
exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

Rows: 322 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): ID, CLASS, GENDER, RACE
dbl (3): ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

title: Hands-on_Ex02
section: using ggrepel package to avoid overlapping of text
text:
using ggrepel package to avoid overlapping of text

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              size=0.5) +  
  geom_label_repel(aes(label = ID), 
                   fontface = "bold") +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("English scores versus Maths scores for Primary 3")

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'


Warning: ggrepel: 317 unlabeled data points (too many overlaps). Consider
increasing max.overlaps

title: Hands-on_Ex02
text:
working with ggtheme package

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25", 
                 fill="grey90") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores") +
  theme_economist()

title: Hands-on_Ex02
text:
Working with hrbthems package

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25", 
                 fill="grey90") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores") +
  theme_ipsum()

title: Hands-on_Ex02
section: changing the title size and style
text:
changing the title size and style

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25", 
                 fill="grey90") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores") +
  theme_ipsum(axis_title_size = 18,
              base_size = 15,
              grid = "Y")

title: Hands-on_Ex02
text:
First plot two single histogram

p1 <- ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25", 
                 fill="grey90") + 
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")


p2 <- ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25", 
                 fill="grey90") +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("Distribution of English scores")

title: Hands-on_Ex02
text:
Next, create a scatter plot

p3 <- ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x= MATHS, 
                 y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              size=0.5) +  
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("English scores versus Maths scores for Primary 3")

title: Hands-on_Ex02
text:
Combine two ggplot2 graphs

p1 + p2

title: Hands-on_Ex02
text:
Combine three ggplot2 graphs

(p1 / p2) | p3

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Hands-on_Ex02
section: Creating a composite figure with tag
text:
Creating a composite figure with tag

((p1 / p2) | p3) + 
  plot_annotation(tag_levels = 'I')

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Hands-on_Ex02
text:
Creating figure with insert

p3 + inset_element(p2, 
                   left = 0.02, 
                   bottom = 0.7, 
                   right = 0.5, 
                   top = 1)

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Hands-on_Ex02
section: Creating a composite figure by using patchwork and ggtheme
text:
Creating a composite figure by using patchwork and ggtheme

patchwork <- (p1 / p2) | p3
patchwork & theme_economist()

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
